pullRequest.body:
add the group correspondence theorem (a.k.a. lattice theorem, fourth isomorphism theorem).

---

edit: forgot to give credit; most of this PR is a translation from [Submodule.comapMkQRelIso](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Quotient/Basic.html#Submodule.comapMkQRelIso)

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [80d98a95fc](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20007/commits/80d98a95fc5c4bd072ff93e268ac6b7c25942f55)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ comapMk'OrderIso`
`+ comap_map_mk'`
`+ le_comap_mk'`
`+ range_mk'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Thanks! I'll update the PR with the suggestions in the weekend

@Vierkantor it would be a separate PR with extensive refactoring of course, but what's your opinion on renaming `mk'` to `mkQ` to align with `Submodule.mkQ`? And renaming bare `mk` to say `mkC` standing for cosets.
bump

:v: jhanschoo can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Hi, I'm finally back from holidays. This looks good to me, with these small suggestions by @tb65536 and myself.

bors d+
Thanks! I have some comments but they are short and hopefully they are easy to address.

Hi, I'm finally back from holidays. This looks good to me, with these small suggestions by @tb65536 and myself.

bors d+

I am surprised we did not have this result before! I would suggest a slightly different proof:
```suggestion
  MonoidHom.range_eq_top.mpr (mk'_surjective N)
```
since this feels somewhat more conceptually accurate to me.

We try to keep the `Defs.lean` files somewhat minimal. Although indeed this result doesn't need any extra imports, I believe it's a better fit, together with the other three isomorphism theorems, in `QuotientGroup/Basic.lean`.

The following suggestion is held with a weaker belief: `le_comap_mk'` and `comap_map_mk'` can probably also go to `Basic.lean`. I would keep `range_mk'` in `Defs.lean` since to me this is no different from `mk'_surjective`, which we also have here.

`range_mk'` is retained in `Defs`, whereas `le_comap_mk'` and `comap_map_mk'` are put in a section for the development of the correspondence theorem in `Basics`. Ideally `Basics` may have a separate section for standard results with some standard development shared with other algebraic structures; and these results go there, but that's out of scope.

The naming convention says that all definitions should be `camelCase`:
```suggestion
def comapMk'OrderIso (N : Subgroup G) [hn : N.Normal] :
```
Suggestion adopted, thanks!

I like the following way of hinting to `comap_mono` slightly more, since it makes more explicit which argument couldn't be inferred. (And I would argue `f` should be explicit in `comap_mono`!)
```suggestion
  simpa using Subgroup.comap_mono (f := mk' N) bot_le
```
Suggestion adopted, thanks!

Any particular reason to choose this order for `H` and `N`? It seems to save a `simp` argument if we do it the other way, without breaking downstream usage.
```suggestion
    Subgroup.comap (mk' N) (Subgroup.map (mk' N) H) = H ⊔ N :=
  by simp [Subgroup.comap_map_eq]
```
Suggestion adopted, thanks!
I agree this does not need a docstring explaining why this needs a `'` at the end. So you can add the name to `scripts/nolint_prime_decls.txt` to avoid the linter warning.
I disagree - this should have a set_option in the file because it refers to `mk'`
Perhaps even with a comment that this is a false positive in the linter.
I've left a doc-string for `range_mk'` in the `Defs`, and used `set_option` in the section for the correspondence theorem in `Basics`.

So that it matches line 30.
```suggestion
def comapMk'OrderIso (N : Subgroup G) [hn : N.Normal] :
```

My feeling is that this should be an ordinary comment that explains a `set_option` rather than a docstring, since this comment has more to do with the linter than the content of the theorem. Something like this?
```suggestion
/- Note: `range_mk'` is a lemma about the primed constructor `QuotientGroup.mk'`, not a
  modified version of some `range_mk`. -/
set_option linter.docPrime false in
```

```suggestion
-- All these theorems are primed because `QuotientGroup.mk'` is.
set_option linter.docPrime false
```

```suggestion
    Subgroup.comap (mk' N) (Subgroup.map (mk' N) H) = N ⊔ H := by
  simp [Subgroup.comap_map_eq, sup_comm]
```

pullRequest.title: feat(GroupTheory/QuotientGroup): group correspondence theorem
